result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James R Menear

records.addlTxt:
File not called on the record. 8:42 AM Defendant James R Menear in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for James R Menear.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gutierrez requests a new date along with further discovery in this matter.
Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:34 AM Defendant James R Menear in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for James R Menear.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Request to adjourn Preliminary Hearing.
**Reviewed by Commissioner Christopher Bailey on 08-16-2022. 'Assuming no objection from the State, the request is granted."
Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:26 AM Defendant James R Menear in court with Intern Erik Schlueter for attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
